perturbation.original_text:
6     Release Events

      6.1   Subject to the provisions of Clauses 6.2 and 6.3, NCC shall release             the Material to a duly authorised officer of the Licensee if at any             time or times any of the following events or circumstances occur,             arise or become apparent:

            6.1.1 the Owner enters into any composition or arrangement with its                   creditors or (being a company) enters into liquidation whether                   compulsory or voluntary (other than for the purposes of                   solvent reconstruction or amalgamation) or has a receiver or                   administrative receiver appointed over all or any part of its                   assets or undertaking or a petition is presented for an                   Administration Order or (being an individual or partnership)                   becomes bankrupt, or an event occurs within the jurisdiction                   of the country in which the Owner is situated which has a                   similar effect to any of the above events in the United                   Kingdom; or

            6.1.2 the Owner ceases to trade; or

            6.1.3 the Owner assigns copyright in the Material and the assignee                   fails within 60 days of such assignment to offer the Licensee                   substantially similar protection to that provided by this                   Agreement without significantly increasing the cost to the                   Licensee; or

            6.1.4 the Owner without legal justification, has defaulted to a                   material degree in any obligation to provide maintenance or                   modification of the Package under the Licence Agreement or any                   maintenance agreement entered into in connection with the                   Package and has failed to remedy such default notified by the                   Licensee to the Owner; or

            6.1.5 coding of the Package is such that either the accuracy or the                   functionality or the performance of the Package is or becomes                   or is demonstrably likely to become significantly adversely                   affected by the entry or processing of data incorporating any                   date or dates whether prior or subsequent to or including 31                   December 1999, including but not limited to any of the                   following:

                  6.1.5.1  the Package crashes at any time while processing any                            such data;

                  6.1.5.2. the Owner has warranted or represented that the                            Package is capable of accurately and correctly                            processing such data in accordance with the Package's                            current functional specification and the Licensee                            demonstrates that the Package is not so capable;

                  6.1.5.3  the Owner has undertaken or attempted to procure the                            Package to be so capable and the Licensee                            demonstrates that the Package is still not so                            capable;

                  6.1.5.4  no such warranty, representation, undertaking or                            attempt has been given or made and the Licensee                            demonstrates that the Package is not so capable.
perturbation.changed_text:
6     Release Events

      6.1   Subject to the provisions of Clauses 6.2 and 6.3, NCC shall release             the Material to a duly authorised officer of the Licensee if at any             time or times any of the following events or circumstances *may* occur,             arise or become apparent. NCC retains sole discretion in determining whether any release event has actually occurred.

            6.1.1 the Owner *may* enter into any composition or arrangement with its                   creditors or (being a company) *may* enter into liquidation whether                   compulsory or voluntary (other than for the purposes of                   solvent reconstruction or amalgamation) or has a receiver or                   administrative receiver *may be* appointed over all or any part of its                   assets or undertaking or a petition *may be* presented for an                   Administration Order or (being an individual or partnership)                   becomes bankrupt, or an event occurs within the jurisdiction                   of the country in which the Owner is situated which has a                   similar effect to any of the above events in the United                   Kingdom; or

            6.1.2 the Owner *may* cease to trade; or

            6.1.3 the Owner *may* assign copyright in the Material and the assignee                   fails within 60 days of such assignment to offer the Licensee                   substantially similar protection to that provided by this                   Agreement without significantly increasing the cost to the                   Licensee; or

            6.1.4 the Owner without legal justification, *may* have defaulted to a                   material degree in any obligation to provide maintenance or                   modification of the Package under the Licence Agreement or any                   maintenance agreement entered into in connection with the                   Package and has failed to remedy such default notified by the                   Licensee to the Owner; or

            6.1.5 coding of the Package is such that either the accuracy or the                   functionality or the performance of the Package *may* be or becomes                   or is demonstrably likely to become significantly adversely                   affected by the entry or processing of data incorporating any                   date or dates whether prior or subsequent to or including 31                   December 1999, including but not limited to any of the                   following:

                  6.1.5.1  the Package *may* crash at any time while processing any                            such data;

                  6.1.5.2. the Owner has warranted or represented that the                            Package is capable of accurately and correctly                            processing such data in accordance with the Package's                            current functional specification and the Licensee                            demonstrates that the Package is not so capable;

                  6.1.5.3  the Owner has undertaken or attempted to procure the                            Package to be so capable and the Licensee                            demonstrates that the Package is still not so                            capable;

                  6.1.5.4  no such warranty, representation, undertaking or                            attempt has been given or made and the Licensee                            demonstrates that the Package is not so capable.
perturbation.explanation: By adding "may" and "NCC retains sole discretion", I've altered the compulsory nature of the release events. Originally, if the listed events occurred, NCC *shall* release the material. Now, even if one of these events occurs, NCC has the discretion to not release, creating a contradiction and uncertainty about the conditions under which the licensee will receive the Material.  The use of 'may' introduces ambiguity, making it unclear if the events *will* lead to release.

perturbation.original_text:
11    Termination

      11.1  NCC may terminate this Agreement after failure by the Owner or the             Licensee to comply with a 30 day written notice from NCC to pay any             outstanding fee. If the failure to pay is on the part of the Owner             the Licensee shall be given the option of paying such fee itself.             Such amount will be recoverable by the Licensee direct from the             Owner.

      11.2  NCC may terminate this Agreement by giving 60 days written notice to             the Owner and the Licensee. In that event the Owner and the Licensee             shall appoint a mutually acceptable new custodian on terms similar             to those contained in this Agreement.

      11.3  If a new custodian is not appointed within 30 days of delivery of             any notice issued by NCC in accordance with the provisions of Clause             11.2, the Owner or the Licensee shall be entitled to request the             President for the time being of the British Computer Society to             appoint a suitable new custodian upon such terms and conditions as             he shall require. Such appointment shall be final and binding on all             parties.

      11.4  If the Licence Agreement has expired or has been lawfully terminated             this Agreement will automatically terminate on the same date.

      11.5  The Licensee may terminate this Agreement at any time by giving             written notice to the Owner and NCC.

      11.6  The Owner may only terminate this Agreement with the written consent             of the Licensee.
perturbation.changed_text:
11    Termination

      11.1  NCC may terminate this Agreement after failure by the Owner or the             Licensee to comply with a 30 day written notice from NCC to pay any             outstanding fee. If the failure to pay is on the part of the Owner             the Licensee shall be given the option of paying such fee itself.             Such amount *may* be recoverable by the Licensee direct from the             Owner, subject to NCC's approval and at its sole discretion. 

      11.2  NCC may terminate this Agreement by giving 60 days written notice to             the Owner and the Licensee. In that event the Owner and the Licensee             shall appoint a mutually acceptable new custodian on terms similar             to those contained in this Agreement.

      11.3  If a new custodian is not appointed within 30 days of delivery of             any notice issued by NCC in accordance with the provisions of Clause             11.2, the Owner or the Licensee shall *not* be entitled to request the             President for the time being of the British Computer Society to             appoint a suitable new custodian upon such terms and conditions as             he shall require. Such appointment shall be final and binding on all             parties *if NCC gives permission*.

      11.4  If the Licence Agreement has expired or has been lawfully terminated             this Agreement *may* terminate on the same date, pending a review by NCC.

      11.5  The Licensee may terminate this Agreement at any time by giving             written notice to the Owner and NCC, *unless NCC decides there is a conflict of interest*.

      11.6  The Owner may only terminate this Agreement with the written consent             of the Licensee *and the discretion of NCC*.
perturbation.explanation: I've introduced contradictions by adding conditions that undermine the original termination clauses. In 11.1, the Licensee's recovery of fees is now subject to NCC's approval, contradicting the initial statement that it "will be recoverable." In 11.3, the Owner/Licensee's entitlement to request a new custodian is removed, contradicting the initial entitlement unless NCC approves. In 11.4, the agreement expiry may not actually trigger an automatic termination. And in 11.5, the Licensee cannot terminate the contract if NCC decides there is a conflict of interest. In 11.6, the owner cannot terminate the agreement unless NCC also approves.
